title: WCAS MATH 220-0-61 Differential Calculus of One-Variable Functions

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value:
Limits, differentiation, linear approximation, optimization, curve sketching, related rates, Newton's method, antiderivatives. Students may not receive credit for both 220 and 211 or 212.

THIS COURSE HAS MANDATORY EVENING MIDTERM EXAMINATIONS. PLEASE CHECK THE REGISTRAR'S WEBPAGE FOR DETAILS: http://www.registrar.northwestern.edu/registration/midterms.html

This exam takes precedence over scheduled meetings of other classes, including labs and discussion sections, held at this time, and it is up to the student to make arrangements for handling conflicts arising from such meetings. In special circumstances, arrangements for dealing with other unavoidable conflicts can be made by alerting the course coordinator at least two weeks ahead of time; he/she will decide if your conflict can be accommodated.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Lectures meet three times a week. Classes are accompanied by discussion sections, which meet one day a week for problem solving and discussion under the supervision of a teaching assistant.
